- Judgment: SUPPORTED - Shloka mentions Hanuman, Sugriva, Vibheeshana discussing how to cross the ocean (Varunalaya).

- Claim: "The concern is expressed over the daunting task of crossing the ocean to reach Lanka with the Vanara army"
- Citation: Yuddha Kanda 19.29
- Shloka text: "उपायंनाधिगच्छामोयथानदनदीपतिम् । तरामतरसासर्वेससैन्यावरुणालयम् ।।6.19.29।।"
- Judgment: SUPPORTED - Shloka speaks of needing a strategy to cross with the army

- Citation: Sundara Kanda 56.34
- Shloka text: "स लिलङ्घयिषुर्भीमं सलीलं लवणार्णवम्।।5.56.34।। कल्लोलास्फालवेलान्तमुत्पपात नभो हरिः।"
- Judgment: SUPPORTED - Shloka describes Hanuman easily leaping across the ocean.

- Judgment: SUPPORTED - The shloka states Rama crossed the ocean with the Vanara army and reached the southern shore.

- Judgment: SUPPORTED - Shloka describes crossing the Kalindi river (Yamuna) using a raft.
